snippet: Federal officials said they agreed to provide subsidies retroactively for insurance purchased in the private market because technical problems had prevented consumers from using the online exchanges.
abstract: Obama administration says it will allow some people to receive federal subsidies for health insurance purchased in the private market outside of health insurance exchanges; shift is latest in series of policy changes, extensions and clarifications by federal officials trying to help beneficiaries and minimize political damage to Democrats in this election year.
lead_paragraph: Federal officials said they agreed to provide subsidies retroactively for insurance purchased in the private market because technical problems had prevented consumers from using the online exchanges.

headline.main: New Health Fix Offers Subsidies for Insurance Policies Bought Outside Exchanges
headline.print_headline: New Health Fix Offers Subsidies for Insurance Policies Bought Outside Exchanges

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
